page.title: 03Churston Court INN
page.content: In our square farmland covered 55% of the ground, the next biggest was the private owned golf course. Churston Court Inn is an interesting 15 century manor house now converted into a restaurant and pub. Next door is Churston Church built in the 13th Century. Through the centre of the square goes the remains of the South Devon Railway of the GWR abandoned in 1965. In Elberry Cove are the remains of the bath house used by Lady Churston of Lupton House. Lady Churston had to bathe in sea water because she had a skin complaint
